channel.title: SOLL on Second State News and Articles
channel.description: Recent content in SOLL on Second State News and Articles

item.title: Second State 又获以太坊生态体系的资助奖励
item.description: Second State 最近获得了以太坊生态最大的去中心化自治组织（DAO） Panvala 的资助奖励。Panvala 由 ConsenSys 创立孵化，为以太坊生态里最重要的基础软件项目提供资金

item.title: Second State receives another grant award for the SOLL compiler
item.description: Second State has been awarded a development grant from Panvala, a leading DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) in the Ethereum ecosystem. Founded at ConsenSys, Panvala provides funding support for critical software development efforts in the Ethereum ecosystem. Past Panvala grant awardees include Sigma Prime, Prysmatic Labs, MakerDAO, Aragon, Status, and Gitcoin. Prior to the Panvala grant, Second State is already a recognized leader in Ethereum infrastructure development. It is had received funding and prizes from both the Ethereum Foundation and Ethereum Classic Labs.

item.title: Diving into Ethereum's Virtual Machine(EVM): the future of Ewasm
item.description: Ethereum is a blockchain with a built-in Turing-complete programming language. It allows anyone to create a decentralised application, by making use of Ethereum smart contracts. “The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) is the part of Ethereum that handles smart contract deployment and execution” (Antonopoulos and Wood, 2018). The EVM consists of a stack-based architecture. In order for a smart contract to be deployed, all high level Ethereum smart contract code must first be compiled into machine-readable code (called bytecode).

item.title: 深度剖析以太坊虚拟机（EVM）的未来：Ewasm
item.description: 以太坊是具有内置图灵完备编程语言的区块链。任何人都可以使用以太坊智能合约来创建去中心化应用程序。 “以太坊虚拟机（EVM）是以太坊处理智能合约

item.title: Compile and deploy an ERC20 contract on Ewasm
item.description: Second State provides open source infrastructure technologies for public and enterprise blockchains. The smart contract compiler toolchain and virtual machine runtimes are critical elements of the infrastructure. Through its web-based BUIDL IDE, developers can easily access Second State smart contract programming languages, compilers, optimizers, and virtual machines. Even novice developers can write and publish decentralized applications (smart contract + web app) on any Ethereum-compatible blockchain in minutes. See examples on Ethereum Classic and CyberMiles blockchains.

item.title: What I learned from Ethereum Devcon5
item.description: The Ethereum Foundation Devcon is the most important annual gathering of developers, designers, and researchers in the Ethereum ecosystem. This year’s Devcon5 in Osaka, Japan is the 5th Devcon, and as in past years, it is a bellwether of what to come in Ethereum. Note: My company, Second State, was invited to give a talk at Devcon5, where we showed off the world's first toolchain to compile and deploy Solidity smart contracts on the official Ewasm testnet.

item.title: Second State receives a prestigious award from the Ethereum Foundation for the SOLL compiler
item.description: (Oct 20th, 2019, Taipei) - Second State, a leading provider of open source infrastructure software for blockchain smart contracts, has been awarded a cash prize for its contribution to the open source SOLL compiler project. Vitalik Buterin from the Ethereum Foundation presented Hung-Ying Tai from Second State with the $5000 prize at the CrossLink event in Taipei on Oct 20th, 2019. SOLL is the world’s first toolchain that compiles Solidity smart contracts into WebAssembly bytecode and successfully deploys onto Ethereum Foundation’s official Ewasm (Ethereum flavored WebAssembly) testnet.

item.title: Second State SOLL 编译器项目获得以太坊基金会的现金奖励
item.description: Second State 是领先的面向区块链智能合约的开源基础架构软件的提供者，因为对开源SOLL编译器项目的贡献，获得了以太坊基金会的现金奖励。2019年10月
